channel.title: What do we need Facebook for?
channel.description:
As if no one already knows this, but... [quote="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook"]Facebook is a global social networking website that is operated and privately owned by Facebook, Inc.[1] Users can add friends and send them messages, and update their personal profiles to notify friends about themselves. Additionally, users can join networks organized by city, workplace, school, and region. The website's name stems from the colloquial name of books given at the start of the academic year by university administrations with the intention of helping students get to know each other better.[/quote]
The question is: what do [b]we[/b] need Facebook for? Everyone's free to join this discussion and express themselves as long as they can explain their statements.

item.title: What do we need Facebook for?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Honestly, I’m thinking of deleting my facebook. It’s just getting to be a waste of time and is just a popularity contest. I have 100s of acquaintances but less than 20 or so people whom I can call friends.

However twitter is addicting lol.

Read full topic
item.source: What do we need Facebook for?

item.title: What do we need Facebook for?
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:49, topic:314058”]We don’t need facebook, but like any “invention” it makes things easier. I have friends all around the country and it’s a great way to get ahold or keep track of them. A lot of people I know don’t even use msn messenger anymore, and the only way to contact them is email or facebook.

Plus I can creep on girls[/quote]

Especially with the new privacy agreement, people just click skip and all of their photos, personal information, etc is viewable by the public. Normally if they want the settings to keep themselves secret they have to go through a big form of sorts.

Read full topic
item.source: What do we need Facebook for?

item.title: What do we need Facebook for?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:21, topic:314058”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=410535.msg3030498#msg3030498 date=1258336007]

nothing, which is why i dont use it

Exactly. Same here.

you’re married too, so, no real gain for you.

where is srt8 anyway?

I wasn’t always married, I didn’t use facebook before then either and I managed to find a girl to marry.

She is busy with finals at the moment.
[/quote]Off topic…but how did you meet her?[/quote]

The old fashioned way, my friend’s girlfriend was her friend. They introduced us. Try it sometimes! (not facebook)

item.title: What do we need Facebook for?
item.dc:creator: @_Sep `Sep
item.description:
@_Sep wrote:

What do we need Facebook for?

Right now? Nothing.

Facebook was ok about a year or two ago. Back when it was used for communication, not meaningless spam by the 3294769742384623497 apps on it. And farmville…egh.

item.title: What do we need Facebook for?
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:34, topic:314058”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=410535.msg3034722#msg3034722 date=1258653801]
Finding people you haven’t seen for a long time
[/quote]

^ that.

I only use it to talk to my sister(live like 1200km away ftl) tbh, msn/mall for social life, don’t need pixels for that.[/quote]
Use it to talk to your sister only? wtf…
Tbh, it’s a real great way to communicate with other people, people who you knew about 8 years back could be on Facebook. (Some of my friends who left school at 6 etc, I’m friends with them now).
You can upload pictures of yourself and leave wall posts etc which get’s a little bit more innovative that MSN’s offline messaging or other IMs etc.

Read full topic
